Posts.Content: Feb 12, 2010 06:19PM cancer2 wrote: I am 1+ year past TCH.  My first hair was like a baby chicken and snow white   I shaved it off.  Now (post chemo) it is without gray, thicker and just past my ears on sides.  The back flips I did not get my eye lashes and brows until a few months ago.  No nose hair yet...  I love not shaving my legs or pits hardly ever.  I think we are all different.  My friends hair is way longer than mine.  Either way it grows back, I promise!
Posts.Title: Hair Hair Hair - Another question Deen Krose53
RESPECTING the STAGE threads **RANT** cherneski Nico1012

Posts.Content: Feb 13, 2010 12:10AM cancer2 wrote: I found my lump  on a Saturday and was at my doctor's office Monday morning.  He sent me for an ultrasound, which again did not show anything,  I insisted the radiologist FEEL the lump; they did the ultra-sound.  I had a lumpectomy in two weeks.  It was IDC, but found at a early stage, only one of the 3 sentinel nodes was positive.  I can't stress how important EARLY detection is.  I would describe the lump as it was just was different.  I had just had my yearly checkup and mammogram 2 months prior.  Go to you doctor ASAP.  I wish you good luck and remember is isn't usually cancer...stay positive
Posts.Title: I found a lump... now what? lexigirl lexigirl
